prompt:
Create 4 prompts for a cohesive, chronologically flowing birthday greeting card that tells a visual story (9:16 ratio):

ðŸŽ¨ CREATIVITY MANDATE: Be genuinely creative, unique, and innovative! Avoid generic or clichÃ© designs. Think outside the box, surprise with unexpected elements, use bold artistic choices, and create something truly memorable and special. Push creative boundaries while staying appropriate for the card type and tone.

Theme: "make it fun"
Style: âœ¨ Smart Style
Tone: ðŸ˜„ Funny - humorous and lighthearted


Message: "!Happy birthday! I hope your day is more awesome than a dog discovering it has two tails and less frustrating than trying to parallel park a unicycle. May your cake have zero calories, and your presents be so good they make you ugly-cry. Here's to another year of you successfully avoiding adulting"



CRITICAL: Create a cohesive visual narrative that flows chronologically through the card experience:
1. FRONT COVER: First impression - sets the scene/introduces the story
2. INTERIOR SPREAD: The heart of the experience - continuation and climax of the visual story
3. BACK COVER: Conclusion - peaceful resolution or complementary ending

Requirements:
- Flat 2D artwork for printing (not 3D card images)
- Full-bleed backgrounds extending to edges
- IMPORTANT: Keep text, faces, and key elements at least 10% away from top/bottom edges (small amount may be cropped in printing)
- Keep text/faces 0.5" from left/right edges for safe printing
- CONSISTENT visual elements throughout: same characters, color palette, lighting, art style
- Progressive visual storytelling from front â†’ interior â†’ back
- Put any text in quotes and make it clear/readable
- Each section should feel like part of the same artistic universe
- TONE: Ensure the visual mood and atmosphere matches the humorous and lighthearted tone throughout all sections
- INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY SAFETY: If the user mentions specific characters, brands, logos, or products, automatically replace them with original generic alternatives in your prompts. For example: replace specific character names with "cartoon mouse character" or "superhero character", replace brand names with "colorful cereal" or "sports car", etc. Create inspired-by designs that capture the essence without referencing any protected names or specific copyrighted elements. Never include actual brand names, character names, or trademarked terms in the image generation prompts
- CONTENT SAFETY: Ensure all prompts are family-friendly and appropriate for greeting cards. Avoid any content that could be flagged by safety systems including: violence, weapons, inappropriate imagery, political content, controversial topics, scary or disturbing elements, or anything not suitable for all ages. If the user requests something potentially inappropriate, redirect to positive, wholesome alternatives that capture their intent in a family-friendly way
- Include visual humor, playful elements, and whimsical details







Create prompts that flow chronologically:

1. Front Cover (Opening Scene): BE GENUINELY CREATIVE AND UNIQUE! Include "birthday" greeting text positioned safely in the center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image). TEXT STYLE: Write the greeting text in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that matches the elegant style used inside the card - legible, flowing, and graceful with natural character and warmth. Create charming cartoon-style or stylized illustrated figures if people are needed for the theme. This is the story opening - introduce key visual elements (colors, motifs, artistic style) that will continue throughout the other sections. Think of something unexpected, innovative, and memorable that will surprise and delight the recipient. Avoid generic designs! Style: !in a charming and whimsical hand-drawn storybook illustration style. The scene would feature a cartoon dog, joyfully chasing two wagging tails in a vibrant, sun-drenched park. The artwork is rendered with soft colored pencils and gentle watercolor washes, creating a warm, textured feel with visible, playful strokes. The color palette is bright and cheerful, full of sunny yellows, sky blues, and grassy greens, evoking pure, uninhibited happiness. The hand-lettered text would be bubbly and imperfect, as if written by a close friend, perfectly capturing the card's fun-loving and personal spirit.

2. Left Interior (Story Development): UNLEASH YOUR CREATIVITY! You have complete creative freedom to design whatever you want for this left interior page! This is your artistic playground - create something genuinely innovative and unexpected that feels right for a birthday card with humorous and lighthearted tone. You can include: scenes, landscapes, objects, patterns, quotes, text, illustrations, realistic art, abstract art, or anything else that inspires you - but NO PEOPLE or characters unless the user specifically mentioned wanting people in their card description. Position any text safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10%). Think of something no one has done before! Surprise us with bold, imaginative, and memorable artistic choices while maintaining visual harmony with the overall card style and tone. Style: !in a charming and whimsical hand-drawn storybook illustration style. The scene would feature a cartoon dog, joyfully chasing two wagging tails in a vibrant, sun-drenched park. The artwork is rendered with soft colored pencils and gentle watercolor washes, creating a warm, textured feel with visible, playful strokes. The color palette is bright and cheerful, full of sunny yellows, sky blues, and grassy greens, evoking pure, uninhibited happiness. The hand-lettered text would be bubbly and imperfect, as if written by a close friend, perfectly capturing the card's fun-loving and personal spirit.

3. Right Interior (Story Climax): BE CREATIVE WITH MESSAGE DESIGN! Include message text: "!Happy birthday! I hope your day is more awesome than a dog discovering it has two tails and less frustrating than trying to parallel park a unicycle. May your cake have zero calories, and your presents be so good they make you ugly-cry. Here's to another year of you successfully avoiding adulting" positioned safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image) integrated into beautiful, innovative decorative artwork. HANDWRITING STYLE: Write the message in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that feels elegant and personal. The handwriting should be legible, flowing, and have natural character - not overly perfect but graceful and warm. Use a nice pen-style appearance with natural ink flow and slight variations in line weight. Think of sophisticated calligraphy that's still approachable and easy to read. Make the handwriting feel genuine and heartfelt. Think beyond typical florals and patterns - create something unexpected and artistic that perfectly frames the handwritten message - NO PEOPLE or characters. This should feel like the emotional peak of the card experience, harmonizing with the left interior as a cohesive spread. Avoid clichÃ© designs and create something genuinely special! Use the elegant cursive handwriting style described above. Style: !in a charming and whimsical hand-drawn storybook illustration style. The scene would feature a cartoon dog, joyfully chasing two wagging tails in a vibrant, sun-drenched park. The artwork is rendered with soft colored pencils and gentle watercolor washes, creating a warm, textured feel with visible, playful strokes. The color palette is bright and cheerful, full of sunny yellows, sky blues, and grassy greens, evoking pure, uninhibited happiness. The hand-lettered text would be bubbly and imperfect, as if written by a close friend, perfectly capturing the card's fun-loving and personal spirit.

4. Back Cover (Story Resolution): BE SUBTLY CREATIVE! Create a simple yet innovative decorative design that brings peaceful closure to the visual story. Reference subtle elements from the front cover but keep it minimal and serene - NO PEOPLE, just beautiful, unexpected artistic elements that go beyond typical patterns or florals. Think of something quietly beautiful and memorable that complements the overall design while being genuinely unique. This should feel like a peaceful, artistic ending that surprises with its subtle creativity. Style: !in a charming and whimsical hand-drawn storybook illustration style. The scene would feature a cartoon dog, joyfully chasing two wagging tails in a vibrant, sun-drenched park. The artwork is rendered with soft colored pencils and gentle watercolor washes, creating a warm, textured feel with visible, playful strokes. The color palette is bright and cheerful, full of sunny yellows, sky blues, and grassy greens, evoking pure, uninhibited happiness. The hand-lettered text would be bubbly and imperfect, as if written by a close friend, perfectly capturing the card's fun-loving and personal spirit.

VISUAL CONTINUITY CHECKLIST:
- Same color palette across all sections
- Consistent lighting/time of day
- Same artistic techniques and brushwork
- Recurring visual motifs or symbols (but make them unique and memorable!)
- Progressive emotional journey from introduction to resolution
- Front cover: stylized cartoon/illustrated characters if people are needed for the theme
- Left interior: CREATIVE FREEDOM but NO PEOPLE unless user specifically requested people in their description
- Right interior: focus on message space with innovative decorative elements (NO PEOPLE)
- Back cover: simple yet creative decorative design without text or people
- Use simplified, friendly, charming character design if including people (front cover only)
- CREATIVITY PRIORITY: Always choose the more innovative, surprising, and memorable option over generic designs

Return JSON:
{
  "frontCover": "detailed prompt with story opening elements",
  "backCover": "detailed prompt with story conclusion elements",
  "leftInterior": "detailed prompt with story development elements",
  "rightInterior": "detailed prompt with story climax elements"
}

IMPORTANT: Create a completely unique and different interpretation for this specific card variant. Use different creative approaches, color schemes, compositions, and artistic elements while maintaining the same core theme and requirements.

generatedPrompts.backCover: Back cover design for a greeting card with a charming and whimsical hand-drawn storybook illustration style. The artwork features a soft watercolor wash background in a gradient of pale sky blue transitioning to a warm, creamy off-white at the bottom. A single, delicately outlined feather, drawn in a subtle metallic silver or pale grey, floats gently in the upper portion of the card, angled towards the right. In the lower right corner, two small, stylized paw prints are stamped in a matching metallic silver or pale grey, suggesting a gentle, quiet conclusion to the narrative. The overall tone is serene, light, and subtly evocative, providing a peaceful resolution that echoes the playful yet gentle spirit of the card's overall theme. There is no text or QR code visible on this back cover.
generatedPrompts.leftInterior: Left interior page of a greeting card with a charming and whimsical hand-drawn storybook illustration style. The scene features a slightly confused-looking cartoon bear standing awkwardly next to a unicycle, with a path winding behind it. The bear is depicted with sweat droplets above its head and one paw scratching its head, conveying a humorous sense of struggle or uncertainty. Two stylized, brightly colored flowers (one orange, one yellow) flank the bear and the unicycle, adding pops of color to the grassy, park-like setting. The background shows a gentle green landscape with trees under a light blue sky with a bright, soft sun. The artwork is rendered with soft colored pencils and gentle watercolor washes, creating a warm, textured feel with visible, playful strokes. The color palette is bright and cheerful, full of sunny yellows, sky blues, grassy greens, and the vibrant flower colors, evoking a lighthearted and humorous mood that aligns with the card's theme. The overall composition is balanced, with the main subject centered and the background elements creating a pleasant, inviting atmosphere.
generatedPrompts.rightInterior: Right interior page of a birthday greeting card designed for message space with a charming, whimsical, hand-drawn storybook illustration style. The background is a soft, textured cream color with a warm, sun-drenched feel, mimicking a gentle watercolor wash. Scattered across the top portion are playful, curling confetti streamers in a pastel palette of soft blues, greens, yellows, pinks, and purples, with small, diamond-shaped confetti pieces interspersed. Centered on the page, the text "!Happy birthday!" is rendered in a elegant, dark gray cursive script, appearing slightly imperfect and personal, like handwritten notes. Below this, the main birthday message is presented in the same legible, flowing, and graceful cursive script, with natural character and slight variations in line weight, evoking a warm pen-ink style. The message begins with "I hope your day is more awesome than a dog discovering it has two tails..." and continues through "...successfully avoiding adulting.". The text is strategically placed to fill the central area, avoiding the top/bottom 10% and left/right 0.5" safe zones. At the bottom right of the message area, a simple, stylized slice of birthday cake with a single lit candle is depicted, rendered in soft peach and yellow tones, providing a delightful visual anchor. The overall composition is balanced, with the decorative elements framing the text and the cake as a concluding visual element to the message, all unified by the consistent art style and cheerful, lighthearted tone.
